requirements: Prerequisite: microeconomics or permission of the instructor.
description:
This course applies the principles learned in HPM 586 to the health of individuals, to health care institutions and markets, as well as to health care policy. The economic aspects of health behaviors, hospital markets, cost-benefit analysis, regulation, and the market for physician services are covered.
Prerequisite: microeconomics or permission of the instructor.
title: Advanced Health Economics
